result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Forrest M. Davidson

records.addlTxt:
1:30 PM Forrest M. Davidson appears in Court, DA Halle E. Hatch for the State of Wisconsin. DE has applied for court appointed counsel. DA Hatch would like to set another STC. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 1:32 pm.
Status conference scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Status conference on November 29, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
bail bond envelope and notice regarding bond posting

ADDRESS INFO for Forrest M. Davidson
Current: N8667 805th St, River Falls, WI 54022 United States  (Effective: 10-17-2022)
Prior: 509 1/2 E. Maple St., River Falls, WI 54022
Motion and Order to Seal Victim Identification Key
Motion and Order to Seal Identification Key

Victim Identification Key filed by DA Hatch
The original document was titled: Victim Identification Key
The original history event date is: 10-14-2022

No Contact with A.K.D. or her residence.  
Maintain absolute sobriety.
No entry into bars, taverns, or liquor stores with the exception of employment purposes.  Once defendant is done working he must leave establishment.

3:29 PM District Attorney Halle Hatch appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Forrest M. Davidson appeared by videoconferencing from the Pierce County Jail pro se. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Further reading waived.  State requests $1,000 cash bond w/conditions of no contact with A.K.D. or her residence.  Absolute sobriety.  No entry into bars, taverns, or liquor stores with the exception of employment purposes.  Notes 72-hour no contact in effect until 10/16/22 at 12:53 p.m.  DA Hatch states argument.  Court notes that personal effects have been packed up and put on porch for retrieval.  Court questions Defendant, he has no objection.  Court orders bond as requested by the State and reiterates conditions.  Court advises of additional standard conditions.  Court advises Defendant of right to speedy Preliminary Hearing.  Defendant waives time limits.  Court finds Defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to those time requirements.  Court questions Defendant's address, dob and phone.  Defendant states he has two options for other residence, Court reiterates he needs to advise Court in writing.  Non-military.  Adjourned at 3:42 PM
Status conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on October 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
